finish off.translation[0].definitions[0]: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
It’ll take me a couple of hours to finish this job off.
finish off.translation[0].definitions[1]: to use or eat all of something, so there is none left
finish off.translation[0].definitions[2]: to complete an event, performance, piece of work etc by doing one final thing
We’ll finish off with a track from Adam’s new album.
She finished off her speech by thanking her sponsors.
Finish off by cleaning the monitor and the keyboard.
finish off/finish something ↔ off by doing something
finish off.translation[0].definitions[3]: to kill a person or animal when they are already weak or wounded
finish off.translation[0].definitions[4]: to take away all of someone’s strength, energy etc
The walk up the hill really finished me off.
